alert.note: Alert for Butler; Chase; Greenwood (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 22 at 7:41AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Chase, northeastern Butler and northern Greenwood Counties through 830 AM CDT... At 741 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles west of Olpe to 12 miles east of El Dorado. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Eureka, Madison, Hamilton, Rosalia, Eureka City Lake, Eureka Airport, Thrall, El Dorado State Park, and El Dorado Lake. This includes Interstate 35 between Mile Markers 103 and 115. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
